attributes.name: check-on-complete

Specifies if the stepper is in linear mode (the user can only click on the next step)
or non-linear (the user can click on any step)

tags.name: wcs-input
tags.description: Mainly inspired from Ionic Input Component

attributes.name: accept
attributes.description: If the value of the type attribute is `"file"`, then this attribute will indicate the types of files that the server accepts, otherwise it will be ignored. The value must be a comma-separated list of unique content type specifiers.

attributes.name: autocapitalize
attributes.description:
Indicates whether and how the text value should be automatically capitalized as it is entered/edited by the user.
Available options: `"off"`, `"none"`, `"on"`, `"sentences"`, `"words"`, `"characters"`.

attributes.name: autocomplete
attributes.description: Indicates whether the value of the control can be automatically completed by the browser.

attributes.name: autocorrect
attributes.description: Whether auto correction should be enabled when the user is entering/editing the text value.

attributes.name: autofocus
attributes.description: This Boolean attribute lets you specify that a form control should have input focus when the page loads.

attributes.name: clear-input
attributes.description: If `true`, a clear icon will appear in the input when there is a value. Clicking it clears the input.

attributes.name: clear-on-edit
attributes.description: If `true`, the value will be cleared after focus upon edit. Defaults to `true` when `type` is `"password"`, `false` for all other types.

attributes.name: debounce
attributes.description: Set the amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait to trigger the `wcsChange` event after each keystroke. This also impacts form bindings such as `ngModel` or `v-model`.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If `true`, the user cannot interact with the input.

attributes.name: enterkeyhint
attributes.description:
A hint to the browser for which enter key to display.
Possible values: `"enter"`, `"done"`, `"go"`, `"next"`,
`"previous"`, `"search"`, and `"send"`.

attributes.name: icon
attributes.description: Name of the material icon to add to the input

attributes.name: inputmode
attributes.description:
A hint to the browser for which keyboard to display.
Possible values: `"none"`, `"text"`, `"tel"`, `"url"`,
`"email"`, `"numeric"`, `"decimal"`, and `"search"`.

attributes.name: max
attributes.description: The maximum value, which must not be less than its minimum (min attribute) value.

attributes.name: maxlength
attributes.description: If the value of the type attribute is `text`, `email`, `search`, `password`, `tel`, or `url`, this attribute specifies the maximum number of characters that the user can enter.

attributes.name: min
attributes.description: The minimum value, which must not be greater than its maximum (max attribute) value.

attributes.name: minlength
attributes.description: If the value of the type attribute is `text`, `email`, `search`, `password`, `tel`, or `url`, this attribute specifies the minimum number of characters that the user can enter.

attributes.name: multiple
attributes.description: If `true`, the user can enter more than one value. This attribute applies when the type attribute is set to `"email"` or `"file"`, otherwise it is ignored.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the control, which is submitted with the form data.

attributes.name: pattern
attributes.description: A regular expression that the value is checked against. The pattern must match the entire value, not just some subset. Use the title attribute to describe the pattern to help the user. This attribute applies when the value of the type attribute is `"text"`, `"search"`, `"tel"`, `"url"`, `"email"`, `"date"`, or `"password"`, otherwise it is ignored. When the type attribute is `"date"`, `pattern` will only be used in browsers that do not support the `"date"` input type natively. See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input/date for more information.

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description: Instructional text that shows before the input has a value.

attributes.name: prefix-label
attributes.description: Prefix displayed before the text field contents. This is not included in the value.

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: If `true`, the user cannot modify the value.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: If `true`, the user must fill in a value before submitting a form.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The initial size of the control. This value is in pixels unless the value of the type attribute is `"text"` or `"password"`, in which case it is an integer number of characters. This attribute applies only when the `type` attribute is set to `"text"`, `"search"`, `"tel"`, `"url"`, `"email"`, or `"password"`, otherwise it is ignored.

attributes.name: spellcheck
attributes.description: If `true`, the element will have its spelling and grammar checked.

attributes.name: state
attributes.description: Specifies the state of the input. By default the input is in an normal state but you can to set it to 'error' state if the data given by the user is not valid.

attributes.name: step
attributes.description:
Works with the min and max attributes to limit the increments at which a value can be set.
Possible values are: `"any"` or a positive floating point number.

attributes.name: suffix-label
attributes.description: Suffix displayed after the text field contents. This is not included in the value.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The type of control to display. The default type is text.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The value of the input.

properties.name: accept
properties.description: If the value of the type attribute is `"file"`, then this attribute will indicate the types of files that the server accepts, otherwise it will be ignored. The value must be a comma-separated list of unique content type specifiers.

properties.name: autocapitalize
properties.description:
Indicates whether and how the text value should be automatically capitalized as it is entered/edited by the user.
Available options: `"off"`, `"none"`, `"on"`, `"sentences"`, `"words"`, `"characters"`.

properties.description: If `true`, a clear icon will appear in the input when there is a value. Clicking it clears the input.

properties.name: clearOnEdit
properties.description: If `true`, the value will be cleared after focus upon edit. Defaults to `true` when `type` is `"password"`, `false` for all other types.

properties.name: debounce
properties.description: Set the amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait to trigger the `wcsChange` event after each keystroke. This also impacts form bindings such as `ngModel` or `v-model`.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: If `true`, the user cannot interact with the input.

properties.name: enterkeyhint

A hint to the browser for which enter key to display.
Possible values: `"enter"`, `"done"`, `"go"`, `"next"`,
`"previous"`, `"search"`, and `"send"`.

properties.name: icon

properties.name: inputmode
properties.description:
A hint to the browser for which keyboard to display.
Possible values: `"none"`, `"text"`, `"tel"`, `"url"`,
`"email"`, `"numeric"`, `"decimal"`, and `"search"`.

properties.name: max
properties.description: The maximum value, which must not be less than its minimum (min attribute) value.

properties.name: maxlength
properties.description: If the value of the type attribute is `text`, `email`, `search`, `password`, `tel`, or `url`, this attribute specifies the maximum number of characters that the user can enter.

properties.name: min
properties.description: The minimum value, which must not be greater than its maximum (max attribute) value.

properties.name: minlength
properties.description: If the value of the type attribute is `text`, `email`, `search`, `password`, `tel`, or `url`, this attribute specifies the minimum number of characters that the user can enter.

properties.name: multiple
properties.description: If `true`, the user can enter more than one value. This attribute applies when the type attribute is set to `"email"` or `"file"`, otherwise it is ignored.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the control, which is submitted with the form data.

properties.name: pattern
properties.description: A regular expression that the value is checked against. The pattern must match the entire value, not just some subset. Use the title attribute to describe the pattern to help the user. This attribute applies when the value of the type attribute is `"text"`, `"search"`, `"tel"`, `"url"`, `"email"`, `"date"`, or `"password"`, otherwise it is ignored. When the type attribute is `"date"`, `pattern` will only be used in browsers that do not support the `"date"` input type natively. See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input/date for more information.

properties.name: placeholder
properties.description: Instructional text that shows before the input has a value.

properties.name: prefixLabel
properties.description: Prefix displayed before the text field contents. This is not included in the value.

properties.name: readonly
properties.description: If `true`, the user cannot modify the value.

properties.name: required
properties.description: If `true`, the user must fill in a value before submitting a form.

properties.name: size
properties.description: The initial size of the control. This value is in pixels unless the value of the type attribute is `"text"` or `"password"`, in which case it is an integer number of characters. This attribute applies only when the `type` attribute is set to `"text"`, `"search"`, `"tel"`, `"url"`, `"email"`, or `"password"`, otherwise it is ignored.

properties.name: spellcheck
properties.description: If `true`, the element will have its spelling and grammar checked.

properties.name: state
properties.description: Specifies the state of the input. By default the input is in an normal state but you can to set it to 'error' state if the data given by the user is not valid.

properties.name: step
properties.description:
Works with the min and max attributes to limit the increments at which a value can be set.
Possible values are: `"any"` or a positive floating point number.

properties.name: suffixLabel
properties.description: Suffix displayed after the text field contents. This is not included in the value.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The type of control to display. The default type is text.

properties.name: value
properties.description: The value of the input.

events.name: wcsBlur
events.description: Emitted when the input loses focus.

events.name: wcsChange
events.description: Emitted when the value has changed.

events.name: wcsFocus
events.description: Emitted when the input has focus.

events.name: wcsInput
events.description: Emitted when a keyboard input occurred.

methods.name: getInputElement
methods.description: Returns the native `<input>` element used under the hood.

methods.name: setFocus
methods.description:
Sets focus on the native `input` in `wcs-input`. Use this method instead of the global
`input.focus()`.

There are multiple sizes for modals. The default size is medium (m), however other sizes are available. Select the
size best suited for the content and screen size displaying the modal. Remember to test responsiveness.

attributes.description: Set the amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait to trigger the `wcsChange` event after each keystroke. This also impacts form bindings such as `ngModel` or `v-model`.

attributes.description: The name of the control, which is submitted with the form data.

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description: Instructional text that shows before the input has a value.

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: If `true`, the user cannot modify the value.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: If `true`, the user must fill in a value before submitting a form.

attributes.name: rows
attributes.description: The number of visible text lines for the control.

attributes.name: spellcheck
attributes.description: If `true`, the element will have its spelling and grammar checked.

attributes.name: state
attributes.description: Specifies the state of the input. By default the input is in an initial state but you can set it to 'error' state if the data given by the user is not valid.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The value of the textarea.

attributes.name: wrap
attributes.description: Indicates how the control wraps text.

properties.name: autoGrow
properties.description: If `true`, the element height will increase based on the value.

properties.name: autocapitalize
properties.description: Indicates whether and how the text value should be automatically capitalized as it is entered/edited by the user.

properties.name: autofocus
properties.description: This Boolean attribute lets you specify that a form control should have input focus when the page loads.

properties.name: clearOnEdit
properties.description: If `true`, the value will be cleared after focus upon edit. Defaults to `true` when `type` is `"password"`, `false` for all other types.

properties.name: cols
properties.description: The visible width of the text control, in average character widths. If it is specified, it must be a positive integer.

properties.name: debounce
properties.description: Set the amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait to trigger the `wcsChange` event after each keystroke. This also impacts form bindings such as `ngModel` or `v-model`.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: If `true`, the user cannot interact with the textarea.

properties.name: enterkeyhint
properties.description:
A hint to the browser for which enter key to display.
Possible values: `"enter"`, `"done"`, `"go"`, `"next"`,
`"previous"`, `"search"`, and `"send"`.

properties.name: icon
properties.description: Name of the material icon to add to the input

properties.name: inputmode
properties.description:
A hint to the browser for which keyboard to display.
Possible values: `"none"`, `"text"`, `"tel"`, `"url"`,
`"email"`, `"numeric"`, `"decimal"`, and `"search"`.

properties.name: maxlength
properties.description: If the value of the type attribute is `text`, `email`, `search`, `password`, `tel`, or `url`, this attribute specifies the maximum number of characters that the user can enter.

properties.name: minlength
properties.description: If the value of the type attribute is `text`, `email`, `search`, `password`, `tel`, or `url`, this attribute specifies the minimum number of characters that the user can enter.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the control, which is submitted with the form data.

properties.name: placeholder
properties.description: Instructional text that shows before the input has a value.

properties.name: readonly
properties.description: If `true`, the user cannot modify the value.

properties.name: required
properties.description: If `true`, the user must fill in a value before submitting a form.

properties.name: rows
properties.description: The number of visible text lines for the control.

properties.name: spellcheck
properties.description: If `true`, the element will have its spelling and grammar checked.

properties.name: state
properties.description: Specifies the state of the input. By default the input is in an initial state but you can set it to 'error' state if the data given by the user is not valid.

properties.name: value
properties.description: The value of the textarea.

properties.name: wrap
properties.description: Indicates how the control wraps text.

events.name: wcsBlur
events.description: Emitted when the input loses focus.

events.name: wcsChange
events.description: Emitted when the input value has changed.

events.name: wcsFocus
events.description: Emitted when the input has focus.

events.name: wcsInput
events.description: Emitted when a keyboard input occurred.

methods.name: fitContent
methods.description: This method make the textarea automatically adopt the size of the content without a scroll bar

methods.name: getInputElement
methods.description: Returns the native `<textarea>` element used under the hood.

methods.name: setFocus
methods.description:
Sets focus on the native `textarea` in `wcs-textarea`. Use this method instead of the global
`textarea.focus()`.

tags.name: wcs-tooltip
tags.description:
Tooltips are used to provide additional information for features available on the website. These can improve the user
experience or simply show additional information. Tooltips appear when the user rolls over or clicks on them
(for longer content).

Note that this component is based on the Tippy.js library : https://atomiks.github.io/tippyjs/

attributes.name: content
attributes.description:
You can use this property instead of the slot API to affect content in the tooltip.

This makes it easier to manage the update if the tooltip contains elements that are not mutated when their
content changes. Indeed, if the slot is used, the tooltip is updated only if the structure of the slotted DOM
changes (the DOM must be mutated).

The two APIs are not mutually exclusive, if both are filled in (the prop + the slot) the rendering will first
display the content of this property and then the slotted elements.

attributes.name: delay
attributes.description:
Delay in ms once a trigger event is fired before the tooltip shows or hides.

You can provide an array with two values to define a different duration for show and hide.

`[showDelay, hideDelay]`

Use null to use default value.

attributes.name: duration
attributes.description: Duration in ms of the transition animation.

attributes.name: for
attributes.description:
The **id** of the element the tooltip's going to describe.

This property cannot be modified after initialization.

attributes.name: interactive
attributes.description:
Determines if the tooltip has interactive content inside of it, so that it can be hovered over and clicked inside
without hiding.

attributes.name: max-width
attributes.description:
Specifies the maximum width of the tooltip. Useful to prevent it from being too horizontally wide to read.

If the viewport's width is smaller than maxWidth, core CSS ensures the tippy remains smaller than the screen.

attributes.name: position
attributes.description: Where the tooltip is going to show relative to the element it's describing.

attributes.name: theme
attributes.description:
Allows you to change the theme used by tippy.

The WCS theme is used by default and uses the WCS CSS variables.

You can create a theme by following this documentation and choosing a custom name :
https://atomiks.github.io/tippyjs/v6/themes/

attributes.name: trigger
attributes.description:
Determines the events that cause the tooltip to show. Multiple event names are separated by spaces.

See: https://atomiks.github.io/tippyjs/v6/all-props/#trigger

properties.name: content
properties.description:
You can use this property instead of the slot API to affect content in the tooltip.

This makes it easier to manage the update if the tooltip contains elements that are not mutated when their
content changes. Indeed, if the slot is used, the tooltip is updated only if the structure of the slotted DOM
changes (the DOM must be mutated).

The two APIs are not mutually exclusive, if both are filled in (the prop + the slot) the rendering will first
display the content of this property and then the slotted elements.

properties.name: delay
properties.description:
Delay in ms once a trigger event is fired before the tooltip shows or hides.

You can provide an array with two values to define a different duration for show and hide.

`[showDelay, hideDelay]`

Use null to use default value.

properties.name: duration
properties.description: Duration in ms of the transition animation.

properties.name: for
properties.description:
The **id** of the element the tooltip's going to describe.

This property cannot be modified after initialization.

properties.name: interactive
properties.description:
Determines if the tooltip has interactive content inside of it, so that it can be hovered over and clicked inside
without hiding.

properties.name: maxWidth
properties.description:
Specifies the maximum width of the tooltip. Useful to prevent it from being too horizontally wide to read.

If the viewport's width is smaller than maxWidth, core CSS ensures the tippy remains smaller than the screen.

properties.name: position
properties.description: Where the tooltip is going to show relative to the element it's describing.

properties.name: theme
properties.description:
Allows you to change the theme used by tippy.

The WCS theme is used by default and uses the WCS CSS variables.

You can create a theme by following this documentation and choosing a custom name :
https://atomiks.github.io/tippyjs/v6/themes/

properties.name: trigger
properties.description:
Determines the events that cause the tooltip to show. Multiple event names are separated by spaces.

See: https://atomiks.github.io/tippyjs/v6/all-props/#trigger

methods.name: disable
methods.description: Temporarily prevent the tooltip from showing or hiding
